links_reviews_title: Cool piece of history; more like XS size
links_reviews_text: So at first I thought the material feels like a heavy polyester and wondered if they had that back in the 30s, but then I noticed the metallic snap buttons at the neck and cuffs were really old, so my doubts dissipated. There is also no garment tags. The top is sheer lace and shoulders are slightly puff sleeved. Unfortunately the neckline was really tight and cut into my throat. Otherwise the fit was tight on the torso but still wearable. It'd say it's actually XS sizing because I usually wear XS tops and this was tight on top. Length was not too short.
very pretty, runs narrow in the shoulders

links_reviews_title: So cute but not the easiest
links_reviews_text: I loved this sweater it is so cute. Couple of things. Mine definitely wasn’t as long as it looked on the model. And it was a tad itchy on the inside from the lurex so if you’re sensitive to that stuff maybe skip this style.
So soft and cozy. Gold threads running through gave it a luxe touch. Slouchy and oversized but cute with leggings or black jeans.

links_reviews_title: Super cozy, perfect for dreary winter days!
links_reviews_text: I loved this sweater. It's very soft and cozy; I wore it over and over because it was just so comfortable. There is a little bit of metallic shine in some of the material which gives it a little spark. Almost purchased.

links_reviews_title: I felt like a polar bear (but a cute polar bear)
links_reviews_text: I think I played myself here by ordering a large when I should have gotten the medium...this was a very roomy sweater, and because it's pretty fuzzy I felt kind of lost in it. it was a bit more sparkly than I imagined, and overall was a little too feminine for me. that said, it is SUPER WARM...really good for a cold snap...and it's soft (not itchy or irritating in the slightest). I have worn this once since it arrived and probably won't again, but again, that's probably more my fault than the sweater's.
Wore during a freezing day and it kept me so warm

links_reviews_title: Cozy, perfect fit every occasion sweater
links_reviews_text: I wore it primarily to work; with black slacks and booties it was just the pop of color needed to brighten my day.

I wore this ALL the time. It was not itchy at all, though I generally do wear a tank underneath. It does have some sparkley thread that you can’t really see in the photo, but it’s subtle. I will say that I felt like when I first opened my nuuly, this sweater kind of smelled...not necessarily bad smelling but it smelled like it had been cleaned with something with a fragrance. I’m sensitive to synthetic smell so I literally hung it up next to the open window for a day and then it was fine. Overall HIGHLY recommend!

As other reviewers mentioned, this runs small so I was happy I sized up. I love this sweater! It's SO cozy and soft. Pairs well with jeans or black joggers. I wore it at least twice. Highly recommend.

links_reviews_title: Cute pattern but slightly itchy and frumpy

This sweater was such a hit! I got so many compliments! It is snuggley as heck and so soft! The pattern and material make this super feminine and sweet. I wore it a ton during my rental period.
Love how unique this sweater is, received a lot compliments! It's soft & comfortable and was great to wear to work.
Got so many compliments on this. It's super soft and has a bit of a shimmer to it.
Absolutely love this sweater. Super soft, great length and I got a ton of compliments every time I wore it. Might end up keeping this one.
An adorable, whimsical sweater that wasn't scratchy at all. I wore it to work on a cold day with jeans and got plenty of people loving it. Seriously amazed that the sweater was not itchy at all.
This sweater is beautiful! Compared to other items in the 3X size from Anthropologie, this item ran small by one size.
This sweater is a bit oversized and very cozy. Enjoyed the eyelash and details on cold winter days.

It's warm and cute, but... It is really wide in the body and short in length. The arm hole is on my underarm, making the garment raise with my arms. The neck is a smidge too tight! Bummer on the fit, it's a cute b sweater!
Fits great! Wore with jeans and boots. The little details within the weave are amazing!
Perfect slightly baggy fit, love the mock turtleneck. Soft material, pretty pattern.

I LOVED this sweater. It's different than anything in my closet right now and could be worn pretty much anywhere. I wore it to work, out, hanging on the weekends. Went well with jeans or work pants. Not even that itchy even though it looks that way!
Love this sweater, it was super cozy and still got a ton of compliments

When i first saw the sweater i thought i wouldn't wear it much. It looks awesome on, with such fun colors stitched in. I paired with black skinny jeans and it was a perfect match. I got a lot of compliments on it and may actually end up purchasing!

Loved everything about this.

Super super cute tucked into jeans or with leggings on a cold day when you want to bundle up and still look cute. I live in the south so it wasn't worth buying it, but I would def rent it again next year.

really wanted to like this one! the neck was very tight and it's cut a little short so never ended up wearing it

It also was definitely a little itchy. Overall fit is what I expected, look is cute, but I just couldn't find an occasion that made sense for it (too warm for indoors and too warm with a coat over it, too cold for wear by itself outside).

I would recommend sizing up, unfortunately for me this was the biggest size option. The other issue is that both I and my friend who is typically a petite small had issues with the sleeves/shoulder area. We think it may be because it is a petite, but its like there isn't enough room between the top of the dress and the top of the shoulder, so our range of motion was restricted despite the sleeves not being too big. Might try a non-petite size (despite us both being petite women), maybe that will do the trick. But yes size up and definitely plan a back-up look if you're renting for an event in case you don't feel comfortable chancing these buttons in public!

links_reviews_title: I live for dresses like these
links_reviews_text: This dress was so comfy and cute. Easily could be dressed up or down and the material was so high quality (it's like a free people flannel but a dress. aka, AMAZING). Highly recommend if you are into dresses but don't like anything too tight
I wore this with skinny jeans and leggings. It’s super comfy and warm
Feels like wearing pajamas. Pairs great with leggings and denim jacket. Nice details along collarbone. Red is better than oatmeal
I wore this a lot with tights or leggings and boots. It looks cute, and was cozy. I am usually a medium but the small worked perfectly!
Great to chuck on with some boots and a fleece. Very warm and comfy waffle material.
short & bulky - Don't recommend.
Fun and comfy dress, loved having something comfortable and cute for a casual situation
On the edge of being a little too short for work but definitely a cute dress! Loved wearing it.

LOVE this dress. I have rented in both colors. The sizing is a little tricky though. In the maroon dress I got an XS, and it was a little short. In the white dress I got a S, and it was too long. For me, I liked the XS better.
I got this for maternity and am 27 weeks and this dress is still too large. I’m normally a small and got an XS after reading the reviews. Still too big. Size down 2 sizes if you can.

Very cozy weekend dress when paired with leggings. Even at 37 weeks pregnant the size small was much to baggy for me. I was able to make it work belted with a camo coat over top. Size down 1-2 sizes for a better fit.

I loved this dress and wore it a lot. It was very comfortable and fun to wear. For me the neck opening was to large. I had to wear a scarf or shawl or my neck felt cold and exposed. Also the color was a little drab. I wished that those two things were different because if so, i would have bought it happily.
Easy dress. Throw it on with leggings, over jeans, etc. Typical free people, runs big, flows, which I like!

links_reviews_title: Fit was not perfect but a cute & comfy dress!
links_reviews_text: I went with my usual size and found it a little short but couldn't size up due to baggy style. It also a little too low cut to wear without something underneath. But loved the color and style!
Cute dress but way too baggy on my frame. Normally I like the oversized boho look, but the sizing was really off on this one.
I love this dress! It’s such a nice material, it’s a pretty color and runs a little bit, which I like.
This was super comfortable, and great to lounge in but felt a little too swing meets baby doll on. Might work for some but I felt like I couldn’t pull it off outside the house.

links_reviews_title: Potential to be super cute but runs large
links_reviews_text: I am typically a M and sized down to a S for this dress based on the reviews but should have sized down to an XS. I could have worn the S and just have it be oversized but didn't have the occasion to wear it. This dress has the potential to be really cute.

I’m 5’8” and wore it with tights, but wouldn’t recommend to anyone over that height or anyone with a long torso over 5’6”. It got a little awkward at the empire seam because it didn’t quite reach under my boobs. It was really cute though so I just threw a leather jacket over it to hide the problem areas. It’s very wide also - size down and rent if you are on the shorter side!

The style was super cute, but I definitely ordered a size too large. I really like the fit and look, but wish it came in other colors. The color that I got matched my skin tone too much and made me feel washed out. It's a great dress to throw on, with sneakers and go out and about running errands while looking stylish. The sleeves were nice and fitted.

This was so comfortable I didn’t want to take it off. As some free people items run rather big I would say this is one of them. I didn’t mind the oversized look but it made it more relaxed and not appropriate for work.

I was complimented once when I wore this dress, but it was really too long and big. I understand that Free People is meant to be that way, but I felt too small in it really. I didn't find myself wanting to wear it.
Love this dress. Runs large though so make sure you order a size down

I LOVED this dress! I want to rent the white one next month. This dress is shorter than I had originally thought. In most Free People, I sized down buuut I'd say this one is true to size do to length. I will get a size small next time.

This ran big in the neck/top so that it came down below my bra in an unflattering way. If I could figure out how to wear something cute under it maybe I would have tried it more. Highly recommend sizing down as it was loose though the body as well.
Really cute, just way too big for me. I wore it anyway!
Perfect for and super cute and comfy. Color matches everything!

links_reviews_title: Love this dress, for is very baggy
links_reviews_text: This srwss is very nice warm material but I wouldn’t consider it a mini dress. I usually take a M, order a S and it was still too big (I would think xxs would fit right). Most comfy dress though!
Fun with tights and boots. Cute and comfy
This dress is massive. Even the small is massive. I tried it on but never wore it :(
Just no structure to it, I was hoping it would be a somewhat flattering drape and this is not that. Color is intriguing but just couldn't pull it off.

links_reviews_title: The dress equivalent of natural looking makeup
links_reviews_text: I really loved this dress. great fit ( I usually buy XL but went with a L), got many compliments! Wore it with tights and docs mostly, but I also wore it around the house/to bed. This would definitely be a staple in my wardrobe.
A very ~Free People~ dress. Soft, flowy, and casual dress which I could wear all of the time.
I wore this multiple times mostly with skinny jeans or leggings. A bit flowy so I would sometimes layer over it to slim the fullness
Very cozy, cute Free People tunic. Wore with leggings and booties. Super comfy and versatile. Lots of complements.

I always wear a small or medium in Free People...so I ordered a medium in this given that I’m pregnant and my bust is larger than normal. It was just slightly tight in the bust but made it look wrong...not cute.
This dress was cute and very comfortable but hard for me to style in winter. The sleeves were way too long on me and bunched up awkwardly so I didn't really wear it.
I loved this dress. Great quality. The length was perfect on me. I dressed down for shopping. But I can easily be dressed up for dinner. The color was like a neutral.

I dont know if i was nervous or just completely forgot how free people runs , but this was to big for me . I still wore the dress out for running errands and lounging around my house . This dress is super cute , more of a laid back look not much room to dress it up obv. But defiantly suggest renting this you really cant go wrong if its to big or to small !

links_reviews_title: Very cute but wish it were smaller
links_reviews_text: Based on other reviews I got the XS, hoping it wouldn't be too oversized. It was definitely small enough to wear, but there is a lot of fabric to this piece. The sleeves are also long so I had to fold them back over themselves. A cute piece but definitely runs large.
THIS DRESS RUNS JUST A LITTLE BIG, BUT IS VERY FLATTERING IF YOU NEED SOMETHING THAT IS NOT CLINGY AROUND THE TUMMY, HAS A NICE FLOW TO IT, AND CAN BE WORN TO WORK, TO A NIGHT OUT, AND MORE.
Was very comfortable and very versital, I received compliments every time I wore it.
Comfortable. Runs really large.

I wore this dress a TON! Styled it as a tunic over leggings, it was super comfy. Definitely runs large - I could have gotten a S and been happy. Perfect postpartum/nursing top. Loose enough to cover the baby weight, the buttons go low enough that I could unbutton and nurse, and real clothes instead of funny nursing tops to help me feel a little more normal/stylish again. Will probably rent again in another color!
Super cute, but runs huge! Ended up not wearing it :(

links_reviews_title: Free People always runs large, and this was no different
links_reviews_text: I loved this even though it was a little big. I typically wear a 10 in pants and 6ish in dresses, and a Small in Free People, so be warned that this will be big. It's super cute and casual and comfortable. I love wearing dresses when everyone else is fairly casual, and this did the trick. Love it as a winter dress. The fabric is pretty heavy, so it hangs really nicely and is made very well. I almost bought it from my box.
This dress was really cute, but you should know that the fabric looks very worn (which is the look). It's nice, flowy, and comfortable. Runs a little large. It's great for the fall with tights!

links_reviews_title: So cute but way too big
links_reviews_text: I'm only 5'2 - I got a size small and I was swimming in this unfortunately. Loved the color and material though!
I really wanted to like it. Unfortunately it just didn't fit. I'm 5'4" 110ish 32A and size small was so big.
Was very cute and fit was good just never got a chance to wear

links_reviews_title: Cute on others, not for me!
links_reviews_text: A friend of mine has this skirt and it fits her amazing and was so cute. But on me, the length didn't quite work (too long) and the material was so thick it wasn't flattering.
Wanted this to work, but it was too tight for me.

I normally wear a size L/14 but after seeing reviews I ordered an XL to be safe. It definitely runs small, and there is no give on the waist. Any smaller and I don't think I would have been able to wear it. Luckily, it fit enough to be wear with a black turtleneck and I loved how it looked. Do yourself a favor and size up!
Paired with a tucked in light blue button down and mauve tights with oxford shoes. It was so cute and the elephants made it interesting.
Love the print and the shape/fit.

I read a previous review saying size up because there is literally no stretch to this material and they were right! Cute skirt that I never got the courage (or the right occasion) to wear. But the material is nice and thick and real embroidery. Love the pattern!
I loved this skirt! Fit perfectly, tight but not too tight. Really happy I went with that size. Easy to dress up or down
I really loved the print of this skirt. The skirt was also really good quality in terms of the embroidery and material. Paired it with knee boots in the winter!
Very cute skirt. Looks good dressed up and down. The only thing is that it has no stretch and it's made out of very think material so make sure you are ok with that

This skirt is incredible and super comfy! You can style it with a plain white tee, or a fancy black bodysuit and look incredible. I received so many compliments and I loved the little elephant pattern. I would say, if you're on the fence on sizing, size down. It's a tiny bit loose, which I didn't mind since I wore this to Thanksgiving.

I LOVE this skirt. I was instantly attracted to it when I saw it online. Between the fun pattern and all the different colors, I knew I had to give it a try. Sometimes I feel like multi-colored and printed pieces like this can be hard to wear because they have so much going on. I found a lot to wear this skirt with though! I received a compliment on it within minutes of walking into work on my first day wearing it. I will say that the skirt has almost no stretch to it. The medium fit me perfectly, but just something to be aware of!

This jumpsuit felt nice. Might fit someone taller (or in platforms) with a fuller figure. It was super cute but the fabric was faded. The design still shows up in photos if you adjust the settings though.
Loved this jumpsuit and it fit like a glove everywhere but the length. There was no way for me to wear them without tripping over myself. Perfect for the 6' and up folks!

Super cute, wore it out to a party & got tons of compliments, BUT I'm only 5' 1" and it was way to long for me. Paired with heels it helped, but not enough to wear more than once. Would look fab on a taller person.

This looked so cute online!! I usually wear a small but knowing free people and the other reviews I took a chance with an xsmall. I was still swimming in the XS and it was crazy heavy, so much material. Even in Jeffrey Campbell's I couldn't pull this off. Material wasn't as vibrant IRL either.
Well made, comfortable, cute, felt like vintage — what else do you want? It’s amazing.
Comfortable and well fitted. Length was great with a 2” heal

Wore this to a Disco Party and out and have never felt more alive. IT IS VERY LONG AND I AM 5'7 and wore 4 inch heels - still touched the floor- so forewarning. But if you want to channel Woodstock, get this.
The jumpsuit was way too long;even with heels on. I would have constantly tripped all over myself

Im typically a small but I got an xs which fit like a glove with the stretchy material. It is super long, I got temporary hem buttons and brought it up almost 6 inches! If you're a lil discreet like me, I found wearing a lace yellow bralette helpful with the low cut in front. I adore this outfit!

links_reviews_title: Should have listened to the other reviewers!
links_reviews_text: So fun! I should have listened to the other reviewers and sized down. Im talk and curvy so I thought it wouldn’t apply to me. I used some double sided tape and wore my tallest shoes and enjoyed it anyways!
I really loved this piece. It does run large. I loved it so much though I might buy it and have it hemmed! run long for us petite ladies.
For a size xs I usually wear a small or xs and this item is fit for someone who is like 6ft tall. This thing hung on me. So sad as its a beautiful garment

When I first tried this on I was swimming in it - the legs dragged on the floor in 2.5” heels and the top gaped at the chest. You can’t use fashion tape to hem the legs because of the material - I tried! Made it work by wearing 2 bras (lol) and a cami and holding the pants up like a skirt while I danced. It ended up looking great and was so fun to wear, but in the future I would try an XS.
I did like these pants, would wear a lot more but due to being quarantined only wore to get grocery’s ( I looked cute though!) The pants weren’t as flattering on my butt as I would of liked.
there also was size in the pants so I can't even guarantee this was the size I actually requested. Fit more like an XS
The pant was a tad large, but I threw on a belt and made it work. The pattern is super in so I wore them despite not fitting great. Overall a very cute statement piece.

links_reviews_title: Fun print but hard to wear with everything
links_reviews_text: Fun print but it fit me really nicely around my butt but too tight in the thighs and made sitting no so comfy.
Can be styled for work or weekend. Definitely a crop flare, I’m 5’4” and the length was just right so don’t rent if you’re tall or they will be overly cropped and awkward with boots
I wore these all the time. I may end up purchasing them. The fit is great, they don't stretch out. I got so many complements!

Good fit since there is a lot of stretch. A little gaping at the waist (I'm 27") but this usually happens to me with pants. Got lots of compliments on the style, I love me a good neutral animal print.
Super cute!! A little big on my waist so had to wear belt. Good to dress up or down.

links_reviews_title: Super cute, a little tight around the hips
links_reviews_text: I love the style of these pants, but I found them to be slightly tight around the hips. They are definitely not high-waisted...I feel like my love handles were definitely on display, so I opted for a more flowy top over them. They are also very cropped. My ankles/calves showed over my Doc's. I would probably go a size up!

super cool pants, cropped with a flare. the pants have a bit of a stretch, so it hugged in aaaallllll the right places but still had a good amount of structure. can easily transition from client meetings to the club. thick thighs beware. little bit tight in the inner thigh/crotch area, but the stretch is forgiving enough where it's not unbearable.
These pants were awesome! They are super funky and I sadly didn’t get to wear them as often as I wanted to. The M was a little tight on me, but do-able. If I order again I will probably size up.
I’m 5’2 and about 100lbs and they were huge couldn’t even wear a belt with them but very cute otherwise

These pants have such a great look. I’ve got an hourglass shape, so I could get these buttoned at my waist because of the high rise, but they were extremely tight on my thighs and butt. I think that happens when pants are sized as S, M, L vs true pant or jean sizes. I thought they looked nice while I was standing, but would have struggled to sit down in them without worry about them splitting!
Couldn't get these to come close to fitting at the waist, so never got to wear them.
I have narrow hips and couldn’t get these pants over them—runs small.
I really wanted these pants to work, but sadly they were way, way too big in the waist.

Per other reviews I sized down to XS and they fit perfectly. I loved these pants they have more stretch to them than I thought and they were so comfortable. I am 5'4'' and they were a little bit cropped, but more hit right at the top of my ankle - still wearable with boots or sneakers.

links_reviews_title: so cute! but look different in person!
links_reviews_text: i loved these pants and got tons of compliments on them, but i will say, the pictures on nuuly made me think they would be a bright yellow and almost a vinyl material. they were more of a tan than yellow and ended up being a denim like material. still super cute, just something to note!

These pants are awesome. I love the flared leg and the snakeskin print. The exposed zipper is also a nice touch. I did expect the material to be a bit different. It's more of a cloth feel than I would have thought them to be from the photo. These also work for girls who are a bit shorter (they just fit like a normal pant instead of a crop).

I loved these! I wore them several times for various occasions and everyone loved them. They are super comfortable and flattering (probably better on tall people). I am contemplating renting these again for sure!

I really liked these pants! The material and the design were both super cool and different. I got so many compliments when wearing these! I'm usually a medium, however, these were a little tight. Once I had worn them for a little bit they did stretch out though. I paired them with a black button down top tucked in for work and it was a very cute and classy outfit! Also, they were a little shorter so trying to pair with the right shoes was a little difficult.
LOVED these pants! Wore to several occasions including dinner, birthday party, and San Fransisco trip. Styled casual with a sweater and boots but also dressed up with white top and coat.
These pants were rockin’ and fit like a dream. Very much a cropped flare though at the bottom.
Obsessed! Got compliments every time. High waisted, easy zipper, nice stretch

Love the style of these pants-they are ever so slightly cropped (I am 5’5”), have a slight stretch, and are high waisted (above the belly button on me), which is how I like my pants. However, they gap at the waist! in a big way. The size small didn’t fit my thighs and butt but the medium gaps significantly at the waist. Won’t buy but did enjoy wearing, just required a belt and therefore looked a bit bulky.
Super cool, comfortable and unique pants. I love these! Considering renting again/purchasing. The coloring makes it very easy to pair with anything.
Such a perfect pair of pants. They look a little yellow in the product shot, but they’re more of a sage. I literally wore them 10 times last month.
I love these pants and felt super cute in them! Only issue is that fit well to begin with but stretched out a lot as I wore them throughout the day
Very flattering fit, but was a tad too long

I'm a 27 in jeans but sized up to a M in these to accommodate my hips. Glad I did because they would have been too tight in a S! The waist gapped so I belted them. I'm very tall (5'11") so I expected these to be short and they were.
Wanted to love them, but the material and print of the pants do not look like the picture. They are very bright green.

I absolutely love these pants! I got a size Medium and they looked like they would be too big before trying them on but they fit perfectly. The flare is just enough. You can dress these pants up with a cute bootie and nice top or keep it casual with sneakers and a sweater. 100% recommend!

I love agolde and really wanted to love these, but it just was not working! I tried them on and then never touched them again. They were weirdly tight in the thighs but baggy in the crotch area which looked awful. They were also very low rise which did not help the cause. I'm sure they would look good on more lean body types, but if you have hips I'd stay away!
The pants are cool and solid quality but the inseam was so short I couldn’t wear them. If you have a long torso I’d avoid these.
These jeans were great! Fit so well and we’re so coMfortable with great details. I’ll definitely re-order!!

These were cute! A little long on me so I had to wear them with heels every time otherwise I kind of looked like I was in JNCO jeans. They have buttons in the waist that allow you to cinch them tighter.
If you have hips then the pleats just don’t work. Not high waisted. Really comfortable, so I wore them with long tops to cover pleats

thought I would love these. got them in the smallest size, to compare with a size 25 I got in a different pair. I'm usually a 25, sometimes 26 depending on the brand... never a 24 but because these are loose jeans, I figured I'd try a size down. anyway... they wouldn't stay up without a belt, and with a belt, they were way too bunched. unfortunately, a waste

I absolutely loved the fit. I got a size 24 and I'm usually a 25. I would try the 25 and use the clasps to make the waist smaller. While the 24 fit, if I tried to tighten the waist it was too tight. This is perfect for girls who are wider in the hips and have a small waist like myself!
These were too long to wear. I'm 5'3" and there was a good 5" of fabric past my toes.

My Nuuly return was coming up and I wasn't ready to split with these jeans... So I decided to buy them. They run a little large, I'm usually a size 26 but I got these in 25. They are SO comfortable I could sleep in them.

Great style in theory. But they’re too low of a rise to accommodate the pleating. The rise was so short and badly shaped that I was walking around like a duck by the end of the day and chafed like crazy! They must have rushed this style, cause it did not execute the way they planned, I’m sure. I sized up to make sure I’d be able to cinch to the smallest snap at the waist and I still couldn’t do it. The exposed snap didn’t look good either. Bummed about this one!

This is my third time renting these and I’m finally going to make the purchase. They are soooo flattering with a crop top. Very groovy vibe. I ended up sizing down just a size. I love the idea of the snap waist but it didn’t actually stay snapped, hence the size down.
These fit, but far too tightly to look "baggy" in the way they're meant to.

links_reviews_title: Nice dress, just not for my body-type
links_reviews_text: I keep ordering dresses with a loose waist, and they always look bad on me. Something about my proportions, I guess. But if this type of dress looks good on you, I'd definitely recommend.
A decent dress but needs a lot of edgier pieces to make it fit well and look cool.
The dress is VERY loose, and, as a result, came off as too Little House on the Prairie for me. I also wasn't a fan of the slight puff sleeves, but I know that's a thing now.

I ordered the Medium and it was way too big. Too wide at the waist, too much material in the skirt, and too long. Oh, and the shoulders and neckline were huge, too. I don't think that sizing down would solve most of the problems - I think it's just a big ol' dress and it will never look like it does in the picture. Maybe if you're quite tall? And you have giant shoulders and no bust? Maybe...

I had ordered a beautiful Anna sui jewel tone dress and nuuly sent me this one instead because they are having trouble managing their inventory. I would have never picked this dress but I can confirm that for someone who is 5’ 4” and wears a size 4 that this dress is extremely unflattering. There is too much material and just sits awkwardly. I honestly don’t know what kind of body type this dress is meant to flattery because it is just a lot of material with no shape.
Too revealing for me to wear, but it did fit
loved this dress for NYE but the sleeves kept falling down all night and I couldn’t wear a bra with it bc the straps stuck out
I wore this to my holiday party and got lots of compliments! The sleeves slipped a little from time to time but that probably just because I have small shoulders (whatcha gonna do?).
This was a great top to wear to dress up a bit more than wear a t-shirt constantly. It’s very light and airy. Great for summer.
It was cute to pair with jeans and cute shoes for a casual office day.
Cute top but wasn't a huge fan of how it sat over my chest, my be better for ladies with a smaller frame.
Loved this shirt more than I thought I would. Adds interesting detail to any outfit and was very soft/comfortable. Highly recommend.
Loved this so much I bought it. Very flattering. Runs super big. I’m usually a large and the small fit perfectly. A bit see through.
Great with jeans
Beautiful shirt. Loved the color and fit, a bit sheer but still wearable. Almost kept it...

I loved this top so much! I did size down due to other reviewers' comments. I'd normally get a small and ended up with the xs. So glad I did. The fit was perfect and the details were lovely! I did need a cami underneath. I wore it all month.
Charming details, but the salmon color was a bit funny with my olive complexion.
Beautiful color, fit well.

I loved this shirt and wore it a few times during my month! It is a bit boxy and see through but that is the style! It looks great tucked into jeans like the model. I would recommend if looking for something casual!

links_reviews_title: Didn’t hate it / didn’t love it
links_reviews_text: The shirt is beautiful and a great color on me but I just don’t like that kind of neckline. It was fun to try something new and send it back. Definitely a fun shirt though. I tied it in the front because it seemed a bit boxy.

Loved this – I am usually an xs-s but I have a small ribcage and narrow shoulders (...but also a relatively large bust). I ordered the xs petite just because that's all they had and I LOVED the fit. Would buy if I had extra in my budget.
Cute top - reminded me of a lucky shirt. 3/4 sleeves. Lots of little details, very cute.
Really beautiful color and casual top. Runs a bit large but not in a bad way, you could size down or stick to usual size.
Looks nice on for a day at work. Sized up since I am pregnant - nothing i was crazy about but enough for work

links_reviews_title: My favorite piece in my Nuuly bag
links_reviews_text: Love this top! So easy to pair with anything

This was such a pretty top. I like the bohemian style which I imagined I could mix when I’m out but for work I like to mix it with professional look so this had that mixture. The blouse was super soft but it was just too big for me. It may fit better if there was an XS and I was a little taller.

links_reviews_title: Pretty top, too large for petites
links_reviews_text: This is a pretty top, but it fit just a little too large all around for a petite figure. The arms, sleeves and whole top in general were very billowy.
This is so much cuter in person. Super comfortable and really pretty color.
Super cute, love the collar and the fit of it!
Really enjoyed this flowy shirt. Looks great tucked in. It does fit a little loose. Size down if you're in between sizes!
This is a lovely top that takes jeans up a notch. I wore it to work a few times when I didn't feel like giving much effort, yet I still looked like I cared.
Looks cuter on the pics of the model. For me, there was a lot of extra fabric, so I had no chance of gracefully tucking this shirt in and it looking good.
Had difficult styling. Ended up tying the front to help with the length - but that didn’t match the overall styling of the shirt
I loved the color of this blouse, but the style was a kind of meh. I feel like you could buy this blouse anywhere, and I prefer to go edgy with my Nuuly rentals. This one just didn’t do it for me.

Beautiful color, but fairly see-through, it that matters to you. I only wore this once. It was really hot here and then the weather turned cold and rainy so it didn’t get a lot of wear. Would be great for a hotter climate or season.
Not flattering. Too boxy and see through.
I could not find a flattering way to style this at all. It fit in the shoulders and the length was fine, but it was so wide and not "flowy" it just made me look pregnant or something.
This top was very light-weight and would be great for spring. I wore it tucked into high waisted jeans. It is cute fully buttoned up or partially opened.
Wore it a few times, the color is so pretty! It’s a pretty flowy top and a tad see through
I got L and could have done a M for better fit - but it is cotton and casual, so it totally worked in L

I loved the color! The fit was just too boxy for me, and even tucked into high waisted jeans, it just wasn’t flattering. It really is a great top, just not great for me. If my shoulders were more broad or I had a larger bust, it might have been better. It was just sloppy looking on my frame. (I’m curvy on bottom, very lean on top.)
Pretty, soft, comfy, I liked the buttons. Color wasn’t as vibrant as I wanted but it’s a pretty top.
Great tucked or untucked, buttoned or unbuttoned. This top is a beautiful color with lovely details. I got a lot of compliments on this one.
Love this shirt. It fit well and looks exactly how it does in the photos.

I ordered one size down as others suggested and the fit was perfect. Can be worn tucked in or out, but I thought it looked best tucked in (and also received tons of compliments!). It is sheer, so I wore a black tank underneath. The details in the embroidery are simply gorgeous! Would definitely rent again.
Many compliments on the blouse. I wore with jeans and with black/tan print pants (Anthropologie - Cartonnier).

Loved the red/orange color of the top (subtle and not overly vibrant). The fit was a little too oversize when not tucked in, but looked great when it was. Fabric wrinkles easily, but the embroidery does a good job concealing it.

I did not love it, but it was more due to subjective issues. I did not feel the color looked like the photo. It was a more muted, almost burnt orange/red. It also ran big in my opinion. A little short and wide in the cut. I would not purchase for myself but it was a nice top overall.
I loved this top with distressed jeans and flats. Looked a little dressed up but was easy to wear.
I liked this shirt. Wore it to work once. Was nice and lightweight for a hot day, there just wasn’t much that excited me about the fit, it’s kind of long so was a bit awkward to tuck in.

I received so many compliments while wearing this shirt. It was pretty much my uniform for the weekend. I paired it with high waisted jeans, wedges and added a French tuck! I wish I would have snagged a picture of me in it! Great for all sizes. Run large but that’s the style of the shirt.

links_reviews_title: So cute but makes you look larger than you are

Stretchy waistband and comfortable fit! Loved wearing this.
Sequins are really pretty, but it was a bit billowy and just made my hips look a bit too wide so never wore,

It was fine. Wish it were higher waisted, size down if that's your preference. Not bow-chicka-wow-wow.

So cute for a festive party! Comfy and the sequins didn’t fall off.

links_reviews_title: get ready to be REALLY PUFFY.

I wound up wearing this a lot because it's been absolutely *freezing* in memphis, and this jacket really gets the job done...but you really need to be prepared to feel like Violet in willy wonka after she's been turned into a blueberry. that said, if you don't mind the major puff, you'll love this jacket.

It's nice to have something different to wear besides all of my black/neutral jackets - I was able to mix and coordinate this into different outfits really easily!
Love this puffer!!! It is a super cute accessory, especially if you live somewhere cold. I got an XS and it fits how you think it would, a little oversized. Highly recommend!
Fits true to size but is pretty roomy, if you are on the shorter/petite side i would size down. Can definitely fit a big chunky sweater underneath!
runs large size down
Cute little jumper
This jumpsuit is so cute, and I wish it had worked out for me. It was much too long for my 5'3" frame. The jumpsuit fits my chest, midsection, and thighs nicely. I'm sad that it was too long to wear.

I didn't end up wearing this jumpsuit out because it was too big on me. Because this was a wide leg pant, the looseness really takes over the look if it isn't the right size for you. I was also surprised by the puffiness of the straps- I was hoping for a casual office look, and it came across a little floofy for my taste. But great fabric quality, and I loved the print.
Very cute and flattering, however the top part tended to bunch up since I have a shorter torso, also the material wasn’t the most comfortable. Still recommend!

Soooo cute! Love this jumpsuit. Color is beautiful, material is lightweight and soft. The frilly straps give it a nice femine touch. Great fit for me, maybe a little loose up top but I am small in the chest.
I don't have much of a bust but it was all a little baggy everywhere.
Super Disappointed I couldn’t wear this. It rode up and constantly gave me a wedgie. Tight in the butt and super large on the top. Weird fit

This jumper was SO cute, but absolutely huge on be. I usually wear a size 4 or Medium. Got this in Medium and was swimming in it. I don't even think a small would fit. The color and material were beautiful, I really wish it fit me!

Worried at first that it cling too much to my thighs but the fabric starts to gently mold to Your body shape. Great color super soft. Straps were a little long for me and pants length was slightly longer than in the picture so I think it’s cut for tall girls

I have a large bottom a smaller waist and got a L and this was so cute! Was a bit loose in the back but still very comfy and form fitting in the front. Love the ruffle shoulders!!! Perf for this time chilly time of year with a turtleneck underneath!

links_reviews_title: Pretty but not the most comfortable to wear
links_reviews_text: The sizing is true, but the skirt waist is rather high to do so, which was awkward sometimes. The tag was ridiculously itchy. If I owned it, I'd have cut it out. The skirt itself is very pretty and flowed well.
This skirt fits perfectly, and the bottom print is pretty. The slit is odd. This was a ‘one and done’ for me.

I loved this skirt and received many compliments. I wore it with brown boots and could pair it with so many different tops for a different look. It is a lighter material than I pictured which was great.
Wore with several different tops because the colors at the bottom match so many different items in my closet.
The fabric was absolutely gorgeous and the buttons down the side were so pretty. I loved the detail!
Such a beautiful pattern! The waist sat very high on me and was definitely too snug. But I’d like to rent it again and experiment with one size up to see if it fits better
Loved this skirt. The print is absolutely amazing and the side buttons add flair

There is no stretch to this skirt. Make sure you check the size chart and order it to fit your largest dimension. I didn't do this, and ended up with a skirt too small around my waist. Luckily, since it's an a-line, I just wore it up higher on my belly. It still looked and felt great. The fabric is beautiful. The artwork -- and that's what it looks like -- is beautiful. It's all very high quality.
Wore this to a museum and felt very appropriate. Sort of big on my waist but I wore a larger sweater over it. Very soft.
Absolutely love this skirt. Nice material and pattern.
Loved this skirt! I sized one size up from what I'd normally order and it was perfect! So comfortable to wear all day long
Loved this including the button detail on the side. Sized up based on previous reviews and I’m glad I did. Probably could have worn my normal size but it wouldn’t have been comfortable
Really cute skirt! The top was a little different with the sizing, but, i just wore it higher up than usual and let my sweater cover that . Received tons of compliments!!

I love the color of this skirt, the fabric is absolutely beautiful and fell nicely on the body. Looked so cute paired with a sweater and booties. I went up a size based off reviews, but it was a little big so I don’t believe I had to size up.

links_reviews_title: Compliments every time I wore this
links_reviews_text: This is the sort of thing that makes me LOVE Nuuly. I don't know how often I would wear this if I bought it, but it has been fun to love on this skirt all month. I get compliments every time I wear it.
Print, cut, fabric, everything was perfect
What a lovely skirt. I wore it for a holiday, and it felt nice all night and looked special.
beautiful material, great length and the button detail is so pretty. I received many compliments each time i wore it. versatile for every season too.

I really loved this skirt, but it was a little tight in the waist. I'm normally a 4-6 and I sized up because there were no reviews. I was able to get it zipped but it was a bit snug. It is very high-waisted and I wore a sweater with it, so it worked fine, but I wouldn't have been able to tuck anything in.
Fit like a glove and got so much wear out of it - paired with chunky sweater, turtleneck bodysuit, booties, etc. Highly recommend!

It was a gorgeous garment but the cut and length is odd. I wore it with spanx to have a smooth line, but even so there was bunching around the waist. If you're a girl with wider hips like me, this is not cut for you. It was tight on the hips and loose on the waist. I wore it once with along shirt over it so you couldn't see the awkwardness at the waist. The length was good and I liked the slit in the side which kept it from being too frumpy.

This fit perfectly. I love the pattern and it has a high end finish. It has a beautiful flow and sways majestically with your saunter ;) ... but this flowing material will wrinkle if you’re sitting for more than 15 minutes. I got 4 complements the first day I wore it!
I wore this to work layered with a wrap sweater and tank. The print was lovely. But fit was a bit off as skirt did not lay flat near the buttons.

links_reviews_title: Loved the cut and the fit but wasn't obsessed with the color
links_reviews_text: Like others have said, the color is brown and blue which is hard to see in the pictures. It's still super pretty but I didn't love it on my skin tone. Otherwise it's a very pretty dress!

I'm pretty curvy, and this dress clung to my backside a little too close for my personal comfort (my husband did not complain). I loved the neckline, sleeve, and back. It looks great on a video conference. Has Ace&Jig vibes. The price is too high for the quality of the fabric. I'm glad I rented it - it was fun for the month.
I loved this dress! The fabric is flowy, and the style is flattering. Got tons of compliments on it. I kept it, because I don’t have anything else like it!
This is a great dress. Got a lot of complements on it. Very work appropriate.
cute but didn't fit

I love this dress, it's the first item I've bough from my box. It's chic, easy, comfortable and I received a ton of compliments. Wore it with heels at a conference and plan to pair it with sneakers for everyday.
Cute outfit, just not my style.
Could not wear this, the sizing was wrong and does not work for the loose fit it shows on the model.
I really liked this dress - the color is more brown than the picture but got lots of compliments
Loved this dress! Looked iffy on the hanger, but I’m glad I took the risk!!

links_reviews_title: Cute on model, but not on me
links_reviews_text: Maybe its because I don't have much definition in my waist, but this just felt like I was wearing a big sack. The only thing cinching the dress is the small tie/belt and it did not stay cinched well. I had to keep pulling the blouse part up to drape it over. I just felt very frumpy in this and didn't end up wearing it. Maybe I could have gone down a size, but I don't think that would've helped the overall shape issues.

links_reviews_title: interesting pattern, doesn't cinch as well on the waist
links_reviews_text: Fun pattern, it is indeed light blue and brown -- but the color combo is what makes it interesting. It didn't fit as well as I thought it could've. My shoulders are broader (still fit), but the top is tighter and the bottom is looser.

links_reviews_title: Simple midi dress, can get many wears
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress. Wore it to a semi-formal wedding with heels and looked great. Wore it for work events with boots and looked great too. Thin fabric, so may need layers under if you are in a colder climate.
This was way too large on my petite body. I cannot wear it.
Not great for petites
This dress was a dream! I wore it for my holiday party but also went to work in it. It was the most comfortable dress I've worn in awhile and fell so nice.

Was surprised to see that this dress is actually brown with baby blue stripes which isn't a combo I'd normally go for. In addition, the fit is all wrong - from the neck down. I think this is meant for something with a large bust and thin waist and small hips? Needless to say, I never wore it.
Not for me. The fabric feels like it will disintegrate if near open flame. Also had more of a sack look than pic shows. So bad couldn’t even wear.

I love these pants! I can see how others may not have loved the style but I am obsessed. I went back and forth a bunch before deciding to add it to my Nuuly this month and I am so glad I finally went for it. I have never decided so quickly to purchase something after receiving. Love.

links_reviews_title: Will rent again but go up a size!
links_reviews_text: Nothing wrong- love the style and want to rent again!
Loved these jeans SO much, I think I'm going to buy them. Great for an hourglass shape.
Wore these a lot throughout the month. Kind of felt like a character from the movie "Her": some future world where they a dress mostly the same, with some twists. Really big pockets.
Unfortunately i didn’t wear these as they were tight in the waist with no give. It is a button and hook and eye type closure. I would size up from your normal jean.
Really liked these, although they give you the ultimate mom jean look. Wore with tight top. Wouldn’t buy, but I enjoyed wearing these a few times.

links_reviews_title: Unwearable and not like the photo
links_reviews_text: These jeans were a disaster for me. They fit fine in the waist, but the crotch/abdonmen area had way too much fabric that was ballooning out. I could have fit a motorcycle helmet in that area, there was so much extra material. The pants were also extremely long - not at all cropped like in the photo. Granted, I'm petite, but these went over my feet onto the ground. Super frumpy and awkward overall, very disappointing.

links_reviews_title: Second time was not a charm
links_reviews_text: I rented these pants one size smaller and they felt too tight. I really liked the look so I rented them again and went up one size. Unfortunately, it was way too big in the hip and thigh areas this time. Oh well...
I loved these and wore them multiple times/week. They’re a dream 90s mom jean and super versatile!!
I love the details and color but it didn't fit me right overall. The butt was a little awkward looking for me.
This is the first pair of mom jeans I’ve worn and I am obsessed!

I was very excited when I received these pants, but they run small and (although I could squeeze in) they were not comfortable. Should I have ordered the right size, I would have given them 5 stars. I love the waist details. I might get them again one size up.
Cute and liked the denim pulls on the size. Not super flattering look on the butt. Just ok.
Cool pants, fit great from the front and the tie details are great, but it completely flattens your butt. Very unflattering.
Fits as expected.
I wore this every chance I got. It was very warm and so cute for layering. Obsessed and wanted to buy but it was at the tail end of winter - too warm for spring/summer!!
would have been great for my spring ski trip (which was canceled)
It is warm and very easy to coordinate with other outfits. I thought this would be great for many years and decided to keep it.
Found myself wearing it all the time. It goes with everything. It is warm and comfy

This jacket is exactly what I had been looking for. The fur on the inside is super soft and lined all the way through, with the exception of the sleeves, the sleeve are still insulated. It kept me warm and dry when it rained. It looked great with every outfit.
I love the versatility and reversibility of the jacket. It's a new staple in my closet.

I’ve rented this twice. The first time I got a small and it fit perfect. After I returned it, I regretted not buying it so I rented it again but this time i accidentally got a size XS. It still fit but not the perfect fit. I love the jacket though. It’s super warm and cozy. It goes with everything

This jacket is so dang cool. It worked well with so many outfits and it was very cozy. This is my first Nuuly purchase and I'm so happy to keep it forever! Fit is oversize style and I still have room to wear a bulky sweater underneath.
Kept this item for three months bc I loved it so much! Oversized. Very warm! Will buy
I live in SF and this jacket is perfect for the weather here. Super warm and casual and cool. Should probably own this, could wear everyday.
Great jacket with a little flair (fur). Easy to pair with pretty much everything!

links_reviews_title: Super comfy + levels up an outfit
links_reviews_text: Soft collar and silky inside with a vintage-y style that makes even a boring outfit look effortlessly cool. Loved it so much I could not send it back so I bought it!
almost bought this!
Wore this a lot, loved it. Oversize fit
Super warm and comfy. Wore this so many times. Fur lining is super cozy and the arms were large enough to wear sweaters underneath.
I love this jacket. I actually regret not buying it. It was super warm and so cozy.
Ended up buying this jacket! Perfect for going out in the winter.
I wore this a lot even though I think a small would have been better! It’s so cozy and warm. I felt like a badass wearing it.
I love this jacket. The liner is so soft, and it’s really warm. Maybe a little too warm for an Arkansas winter, but I had it during the coldest months so it worked out great.

links_reviews_title: Love this - was HARD not to buy it!
links_reviews_text: Loved this jacket - so warm and cute. Got tons and tons of compliments
I felt like a boss in this jacket. It did run big, but I think that’s probably how you want it. Not to mention it kept me SO warm!
this jacket is amazing. warm, stylish and can't take it off. may keep it forever.
I got a ton of compliments on this when I wore it! It’s so warm and cute. Perfect for any casual occasion
This jacket does run a bit large but its the sort of jacket you want some extra room in i think. Its an everyday type of jacket in the cooler months.

links_reviews_title: Loved it so much I bought it
links_reviews_text: I needed a warm jacket for winter and this one has been MY FAVORITE. I’ve dressed it up with cute boots and a hat & dressed down with a hoodie and sneakers. I get compliments every time I wear it AND it keeps me warm!
I may just need to buy it. I have gotten it twice now just to be sure I love it and I really do. it's soooo soft inside and fits slightly oversized but still fits great!
Love this jacket, very warm and funky. Only negative was it def added bulk/wasn't very flattering in photos.
The faux fur is very comfy and warm. This style fits so many outfits.
Normally I would get a large but I sized down to an M and it fit perfectly! I wore it so many times I never had a denim jacket before and this one made me realize that I need more denim in my life!

This jacket was everything I could have wanted. I was really looking for a warm denim jacket to wear during the colder months and this was perfect. Not only was it fur lined but the sleeves were insulated as well so it was not too hot but still kept you warm. I really lucked out with this one and could wear it as my coat without another on top since the temperature stayed in the 40 range. Probably going to rent this one again!
Loved this jacket and got a lot of compliments on the collar!
Looks great - but too bulky to actually wear
Absolutely obsessed might buy it, so cute.
This jacket was much warmer than I anticipated and I should’ve bought it. Tbh I might just have to reorder... winter isn’t close to over where I live :(

This jacket is the BEST. It’s so warm and comfortable and super cute. I wore this so many times and couldn’t get enough of it. It does run a bit large. It’s also reversible but I never wore the flip side.
This was fun to wear over all black workout outfits

I’m 6 feet tall, and was swayed to size down per the reviews. The medium fits, but for tall gals like me, I wish I would’ve got a large for a longer fit. The medium doesn’t look as oversized as I wanted, and I wish I would’ve gone with a large. That being said, I still wore it a bunch. Thinking about buying this in a large...
I wore this everywhere - running errands, day drinking, even to work on Friday's. It is so fun, warm but not to warm, and soft. I almost bought it but I have too many jackets.
The shoulders are definitely large on a petite frame, and because it is so well-lined it is a bit bulky, but it's a nice casual look when you need something super warm and soft.

I loved that this is clearly a denim jacket- but it much warmer than most on market as it is fur-lined. Felt warm and durable and easy to wear over sweaters and tops. Also- didn't realize- but its reversable! The fur is like a vest when reversed and there is a shiny lining. Kind of like a baseball looking bomber jacket- but real funky. I'll probably not wear it that way, but gotta love options!
I really liked the jacket. It has an oversized fit, so I went for an XS and it was perfect.
It does run quite large. Size down for sure. It’s warm and retro, I loved it.
Wore a few times. It’s an oversized fit but liked the bagginess and warmth.
Felt very masculine

This jacket is a keeper! Size down at least one size. I’m usually a small in jackets but got an XS and it’s still roomy enough to wear sweaters under. It is still oversized after sizing down but the perfect amount.

This Jean jacket is amazing. Super warm and plush. Very well made and great color. I’m usually a large in jackets in order to layer... but this runs HUGE. It was large on my husband who wears a men’s large in Levis. I’m still going to wear it but recommend sizing down.
Loved this piece! Super cute and wearable, there was a little bit of squeaking going on, but forgivable for how cute it is :)

links_reviews_title: So cute and got lots of compliments!
links_reviews_text: I felt like Lizzie McGuire in this jacket! So fun to wear for the day and got lots of compliments. Adds the perfect dash of fun to an otherwise plain outfit.
I loved this. It was so cute and fun and different. The material in comfortable although it is a bit squeaky when you move around!
Rented this for a friend’s 2000s themed birthday party and it was perfect! Fitting was true to size, and the medium was even a little big on me.
LOVED this unique jacket!

I wore this for a galentine’s night out and it was so amazing. Got so many compliments and felt like a blend of Carrie Bradshaw and Cher Horowitz. Fits true to size, it’s lined but it definitely doesn’t breath.. so was a bit balmy for an LA evening but no regrets.

links_reviews_title: Great coat for Cali, but winter in NJ, no
links_reviews_text: Loved this coat and the fit and materials were awesome. Unfortunately for me, it wasn't suitable to wear in East Coast weather as very lightweight. Would be great for a warm weather climate though!

This jacket is to die for. Every time I wore it, people (always much younger women) went out of their way to tell me how much they loved it. I was skeptical at first (I thought it looked a little like a poodle) but paired with a button down and jeans, it was smashing. Other reviewers mentioned the fabric being noisy, but I didn’t notice that at all. This one may be a keeper!
Wicked cute, fits well
Wore this to my family Christmas trip in SF and on NYE. Made the outfit!! Def would rent again.

I wore this to a party and received lots of compliments. It's pleather so it was hot to wear inside. I was waiting for a day when it was cold enough to wear outside but it didn't happen. Planning on renting it for January.
It's one of a kind. Sold out everywhere too. I bought it after too. Although its a statement piece, it's so unique and gives flare to any night outfit.

links_reviews_title: make a vinyl noise at any moving. disturbing motion.
links_reviews_text: make a sticky vinyl noise at any motion, and could not move due to this weird sticky sounds. could not wear it because unnecessary attention from others. too much vinyl surface looks cheap.
Made me feel like a million bucks
Loved it! Great cut, warm enough

This jacket is so fun! Definitely not an everyday jacket since its bright blue and leathery with fur but I got so many compliments when I wore it! Its a little cropped but looked great with high waisted jeans!

links_reviews_title: Weird I wasn't born in this
links_reviews_text: I love this TOO much. I feel like Cher Horowitz. The pros are this is a showstopper that made me walk like a teen quee6bee which makes me wonder if I could have ruled my school had I only had a baby blue pleather dream coat. The cons are that it's a little boxy and doesn't look that cute buttoned up, and the button holes are a tad small so it's really hard to use them anyway.
Cute, yes, but tight all over. And possibly too young for me. Plus...where do I wear this in Vermont??
I was so so excited to wear this but it was too big for me :// so cute tho

links_reviews_title: Hilary Duff/Spice Girl/2000's dream come true
links_reviews_text: This was such a fun jacket to wear. It is very warm since it is plastic. I paired it with light jeans and the black silk tie dye pants from nuuly. Would experiment more in the spring with mini skirts and boots.
I'm bummed I only wore this once but will definitely rent it again. Fit great, love it. The sleeves are a little...squeaky bc of the material but I didn't mind.
This was a crowd pleaser!! such a great statement piece

links_reviews_title: Show Stopper & heart palpitations fluttered around this jacket!
links_reviews_text: Loved it.

This is the key piece of my Fran Fine Halloween costume. It's standing in as the iconic Byblos powder blue feather-cuff blazer from the Nanny episode “Curse of the Grandmas,” original air date Oct. 1994. :)
the fit wasn't my favorite
If you like this sort of piece, it’s amazing. So much fun and good quality. Got compliments all day and will definitely rent again.

This is a super fun piece! Received lots of compliments and it's definitely a show stopper. Although this is true to size, I would recommend sizing down if you want it to fit more like the way the model is wearing it.
